intro: Haplopappus bloomeri, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and gray-green, adapted to reduce water loss in harsh conditions. Haplopappus bloomeri plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
